We need to be sending along the http auth information with the requests in order to avoid this problem. I've created another report (bug#161791) that discusses adding an authentication page where these credentials can be added (along with converting to a different http library). I hope to get these resolved for the next release (0.9) scheduled for November 10.

Some more information on this bug. 
I am unable to create attachments from within eclipse. I guess the task context is a particular case of attachment to a bugzilla issue.
*** Bug 158508 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed. I've added support for http authentication and these changes will be available in the next release (and will be in the next developer build, this afternoon). Http authentication credentials now entered in Task Repository settings page.
David: a dev build will be available within 4 hours so that you can try this out.
Wow, sounds great! I'll download that dev build in a few hours and give it a try.
Thanks David, and while you're at it, keep an eye on encoding related issues since this may have been affected by the conversion to httpclient.

...and tested the new dev build. It works great! It correctly uses my http auth credentials without annoying popups, yay!

...however...

 as per Robs suggestion, i tested some encoding related functionality.

Thanks a lot guys. It is impressive the speed at which this bug was resolved; at least since I reported it to date, its been only a couple of weeks at the most.
I updated to the dev build and it is working like charm. I am now able to create attachments in bugzilla from within eclipse which I couldn't before. 
I'll keep an eye on the encoding issues mentioned and will post any problem I find with it if I ever do.
Thanks again.
